factoriores.jei.sulfur_process: Sulfuric Acid can be obtained by setting Blocks of Sulfur on fire
block.factoriores.mechanical_miner.toolt: Used for _mining_ ores from large _ore deposits_ in the world.
Starts _mining_ ores, when placed on a valid _ore deposit_
create.ponder.mechanical_miner.header: Extracting ores using the Mechanical Miner
create.ponder.mechanical_miner.text_1: The Mechanical Miner extracts ores by drilling when placed on an ore deposit
create.ponder.mechanical_miner.text_2: It can be powered from the side using cogwheels
create.ponder.mechanical_miner.text_3: Its mining speed depends on the Rotational Input
create.ponder.mechanical_miner.text_4: After some time, the result can be obtained via Right-click
create.ponder.mechanical_miner.text_5: The outputs can also be extracted by automation
create.ponder.mechanical_miner_lixiviant: Using the Mechanical Miner with lixiviants
Some ores are too hard to be mined by hand and need to be dissolved by a lixiviant
One valid lixiviant, per default configuration, is Sulfuric Acid
create.ponder.mechanical_miner_fluid_dep: Extracting fluids using the Mechanical Miner
Some deposits contain fluids, and cannot be mined by hand
Simply place a valid tank on top of the miner
and it will extract the fluid into the tank
commands.setblockoredeposit.failed: Could not set the block (check block is a FactoriOres ore deposit)
commands.setblockoredeposit.failed_on_ty: The input block is not a valid FactoriOres ore deposit
